name: Blue Diamond Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this 3 star hotel is the location. We just walked to all the tourist spots in the City and the Ben Tanh market. Our room was clean, specially the bathroom. Our towels were thick and fairly new. They were changed every day, so I don't understand why some reviewers were complaining about threadbare towels. I almost brought my own but didn't want them eating into my shopping space. Disposable toothbrushes and bottles of mineral water were given every day. Two thumbs up. We arrived at 11 am which is way before check in time. We were lucky though as there was a room immediately available. I was so thankful for that because my hubby wasn't feeling too good after the plane ride. Service was always with a smile. Breakfast was ok. Hubby loved the very tasty porridge. I specially loved the cable tv. As both of us weren't feeling too good, we spent a lot of time in the room watching movies. I wouldn't going back to stay here and would highly recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed only 1night, previously stayed in Hanoi (Hanoi Moments) which was fantastic, and the service was top notch. However upon arriving to Blue Diamond Hotel in HCM, we found the service to be poor. The staff's English skills were lacking and their approach to our questions weren't of satisfaction. They were not helpful and were not very warm towards us and our questions. It was a little odd considering most hotels we stayed in, in Vietnam had wonderful customer service and were more than willing to help. Rooms were sufficient, breakfast was decent and locations was good. If they could improve on customer service and their willingness to help, that would make this an ok hotel to stay in.
reviews.title: Lacks customer service!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for one night in the rooms with the window. The hotel is in a good location and for the hotel staff was friendly. We were able to check in early for one our rooms . Although the rooms are clean, I wouldn't recommend staying here for an extended period of time as it can be very noisy (you can hear the people in the rooms next to you and those talking in the hallway very clearly). Also I think they allow people to smoke in their rooms so on our floor there was a strong cigarette smell looming in the hallway. And the free breakfast was pretty good. Overall for the price ($62) it was decent.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: After doing much research on Trip Advisor we booked the Blue Diamond in HCMC. From the moment we arrived the staff could not do enough for us. We had a deluxe room on the 4th floor and it was fantastic. The hotel is new and the rooms are well appointed with comfortable beds. It was also fairly quiet, except for the family that had two rooms opposite each other that liked to leave the doors open and the kids ran from room to room from about 4.30am. This only happened once thank goodness. The hotel is within walking distance of most attractions.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel with great Staff

reviews.text: I don't know whether this is the case in all hotels in HCMC or just the Blue Diamond.
reviews.title: Average
Great location, basic rooms bit too basic
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night during our trip to SE Asia.

reviews.title: friendly service, convenient location, clean and modern room.
reviews.text: We booked the cheapest room, which means no view, or even window, to speak of. Also the room was rather small, albeit clean and pretty nicely decorated. Facilities were pretty standard as such, WiFi everywhere, TV, coffee facilicities, etc.

reviews.title: Greate Value. Will stay again
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is pretty good, just on the edge of District 1, so most of the sights are within walking distance. It may be due to us not liking HCMC much, but we felt the staff wasn't quite as extremely attentative as elsewhere in Vietnam.

reviews.title: Clean, comfortable & great location
reviews.text: For instance, We booked a tour to the Cu Chi tunnels through the hotel reception but were told that we'd have to get a taxi in addition to paying for the tour as they wouldn't come to pick us up from the hotel, everywhere else this wasn't the case.

reviews.title: Friendly stay in good location
reviews.text: The breakfest buffet included in the price was really rather good, plenty of choice and tasty, also the restaurant and lounge are stylishly decorated, albeit rather empty.

reviews.title: More than worth the money
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in room 604. Yes it has the window wall to the bathroom but does have blinds for privacy. Room also has a window but no view other than wall opposite.Excellent comfy Queen size bed, all amenities including free wifi in the room as well as computers in the restaurant. Excellent choce/range of breakfast, westen and asian including egg station. Partner said the best Pho Bo he had in HCMC and he had a few.Great reception staff, helpful with directions etc. Only a few minutes walk to Ben Thanh markets so very central. Great value for money.

reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay here
reviews.text: No real complaints. Great location. We selected higher end rooms to be sure we got windows to the outside which is important to us. Good bang for the buck hotel in HCMC.

reviews.title: Damp diamond!!
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in April. We booked from the hotel a taxi to come and pick us up from the airport. Vietnamese airline decided to change the flight number at the last minute. we arrived 40 mins late. There wasnt a taxi there waiting for us. they didnt bother to check the old flight number.When we left the senior admin person forced us to pay for the taxi we didnt have. she was very rude and she ended up shouting at us at the lobby.

reviews.title: Overpriced hotel in District 1
reviews.text: They didnt bother to show us the room. they gave us the key and they said go upstairs and find it. Also when we arrived at the hotel the room was very smelly and stank of damp. there are no windows in the rooms (actually there is a small window that faces the corridor, but not external window. no day light at all) Broken bath so water could go everywhere. the location is great, thats the only thing positive about that place, oherwise i will not recomend that hotel. very pricey for what it is. there are loads of nice hotels in the same street and cheaper.

reviews.title: High standard hotel in central location, but bed a little uncomfortable and no swimming pool
reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, location is the high point of this hotel. The Blue Diamond is located in District 1, which is one of the reasons why we chose it. It takes a 15 minutes walk to reach the Opera, while a a taxi should cost around 20,000 VND. Ben Than Market is also within walking distance.

We had a wonderful stay at the lue Diamond Hotel. We chose to stay there based on TripAdvisor reviews. For 28 pounds we were very impressed - luxury bathroom with drench shower, flat screen tv, free wi-fi, lovely decor and friendly staff. Our basic room didn't have a window, which wasn't a problem for us, and the breakfast buffet had limited western choice of foods (which seems to be a common theme across Vietnam).
reviews.title: Fantastic customer service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good - nice area to stroll around, and go see some sites. Do try to learn what to pay for items on the street though as it's very easy to be taken advantage of (tell them what you want to pay for drinks/snacks, then you'll know straight away ì you're happy to pay the price.
reviews.title: Over-priced
Yes, it's all right, and you can stay there with confidence
reviews.text: The hotel and staff were nice and friendly but the price of the room was not worth it. I've stayed in budget accommodations in HCMC before and would have rather paid $20 to stay in a cheaper place than the $55 that Blue Diamond charged. The room was clean but small. My main complaints were the poor quality of the towels, the low water pressure, the construction happening in the room next to ours that started in the morning and the sad excuse for a morning buffet (the quality of the food was poor and if you did not get there early enough, you would miss out on the more appealing dishes). The staff were ever helpful and the location was excellent. The beds were comfortable, but a "double" was really two twins pushed together and I believe that was the case for every room (I peeked in a couple of them when the maids were cleaning). Overall, not worth the price.

We spent 3 nights here at the beginning of 4 weeks in Vietnam, and then 1 night at the end. After our initial stay, we were very pleased; after experiencing other 3-star hotels in Vietnam, we were less enthusiastic.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: The locations and the friendly staff are among the pluses. But even after having to upgrade to a Deluxe room ($79) because no standard rooms were available, it's short on amenities. The Blue Diamond was the only hotel we stayed at that offered neither a welcome drink nor fruit in the room. The bathroom was equipped with only one small threadbare bath towel and smaller hand-towel each.
reviews.title: be careful when booking triple/luxury room!!!
